venue.address_2: Near the Barrett's Pond camping area
venue.name: Equestrian Parking Lot

item.description:
Hike along the dirt roads of Myles Standish State Forest discovering how the forest has changed over time. We’ll take a look at a recently forested area, an old homestead including two gravestones, and an abandoned cranberry bog.

Meet at the Equestrian Parking Lot (parking lot #3) near the Barrett’s Pond Camping Area. See trail map to find location: http://www.mass.gov/d....

Program is free and open to the public. For ages 8 and up. Rain or shine – severe weather will cancel. For more information, call Amy at (508) 272-9376. For park information and directions, visit www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/southeast/mssf.htm.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for DCR Regional Interpretive Coordinator Amy!

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: The Changing Landscape
